ovdesc.p: This screen is used to define the publicly known Head Office-Branch Office relationships between banks in the payments hub.
A record created in this screen will create or amend or delete a record in store table, PPT.AGENT.

The store table is referred using a BIC(Business Identifier Code) and not NCC(National Clearing Code). If only NCC is available, payments hub derives BIC from NCC and then refers PPT.AGENT for locating an agent. The located agent could however be identified using BIC or NCC.

desc.p: Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
Indicates the BIC of the party for which an agent is sought by the payments hub.
BIC can be specified in BIC-4. BIC-6, BIC-8 or BIC-11
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
The value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered active by the payments hub.
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each agent in the application.
Identifies the agent with either a BIC or a NCC.
BIC value can be specified as a BIC-8 or a BIC-11 only.
NCC value can have alphanumeric characters which is usually of length 8.
Indicates the type of identifier used to denote an agent.
B - When a BIC-8 or a BIC-11 is used to denote the agent.
N - When NCC is used to denote the agent.
Mandatory field. 1 alphanumeric characters. User can assign a value based on possible values only.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table.

Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered inactive by the payments hub.
Unique ID generated by the payments hub in order to identify each record in the application.
Used for internal purpose. Holds the ID of the previous live record of store table.
